snippet.textDisplay: 1994... yikes!  Over 20 years ago...  Yet the soundtrack for Super Metroid still sounds great.  Every song is memorable and inspiring.  All I think of when I hear this song is the sound the plasma beam makes... along with the Plasma Space Pirates

snippet.textDisplay: I KNOW he's going to pick EarthBound and Chrono Trigger for certain. I just hope he'll put up Mother 3, since that game is like a masterpiece to me. All 4 of my predictions, in my opinion, are masterpieces, actually (Ocarina of Time has a couple of flaws keeping it from being masterpiece material, picked it because everyone's nostalgic about it and I think Supra might be too!). I hope that, if Mother 3's not its own upload, it'll be in a joint upload with EarthBound, like with Shenmue 1 and 2
snippet.textOriginal: I KNOW he's going to pick EarthBound and Chrono Trigger for certain. I just hope he'll put up Mother 3, since that game is like a masterpiece to me. All 4 of my predictions, in my opinion, are masterpieces, actually (Ocarina of Time has a couple of flaws keeping it from being masterpiece material, picked it because everyone's nostalgic about it and I think Supra might be too!). I hope that, if Mother 3's not its own upload, it'll be in a joint upload with EarthBound, like with Shenmue 1 and 2

snippet.textDisplay:
While I'm certainly not going to say "fuck off CoD fanboy", your statement "if a kid picked this up today he'd get bored within 5 minutes", is just as baseless and ignorant as if I did..What survey and infinite wisdom are you basing this off of?? I bet the subscribers of this channel can attest to the fact that plenty of younger users love this game.  
Perhaps you don't like it b/c it isn't rly a platformer... in a pure sense a platformer is linear and has "pits of death", this game has neither.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: This song never fails to make the hair on my arms stand up. There are other games out there whose soundtracks I enjoy more, but I don't know if any of them, song for song, are as atmospheric as Super Metroid.

snippet.textDisplay: Although not my favorite song in the game, it definetly holds atmosphere.

snippet.textDisplay: I can't understand the hype over this game and earthbound, I'm not saying they're bad games, I just think everyone seems a little bit too nostalgia blind, if a kid picked this up today he'd get bored within 5 minutes, I got about 20 minutes through and it just began to feel like homework. :| don't say "fuck off cod fanboy" because I don't even like fps's. I love platformers, the snes had some great one like Yoshi's Island. I just don't get why this is so amazing.
snippet.textOriginal: I can't understand the hype over this game and earthbound, I'm not saying they're bad games, I just think everyone seems a little bit too nostalgia blind, if a kid picked this up today he'd get bored within 5 minutes, I got about 20 minutes through and it just began to feel like homework. :| don't say "fuck off cod fanboy" because I don't even like fps's. I love platformers, the snes had some great one like Yoshi's Island. I just don't get why this is so amazing.

snippet.textDisplay: I used to hate super metroid, but some time ago I decided to play it whole with a friend. I could not be more wrong, and Metroid quickly joined my list of best Super Nintendo games. Like Castlevania: Symphony of the Night won me over on the Playstation 1, Super Metroid on the SNES won my respect. Unforgettable.
snippet.textOriginal: I used to hate super metroid, but some time ago I decided to play it whole with a friend. I could not be more wrong, and Metroid quickly joined my list of best Super Nintendo games. Like Castlevania: Symphony of the Night won me over on the Playstation 1, Super Metroid on the SNES won my respect. Unforgettable.

snippet.textDisplay: A pretty damn perfect game. My 5th favorite, in fact.
snippet.textOriginal: A pretty damn perfect game. My 5th favorite, in fact.

snippet.textDisplay: The claustrophobic environments mixed with the sense of discovering the unknown, the perfect difficulty level, the pure and fun gameplay, the great pixel work and an awesome soundtrack created a classic. Just listening to the Tourian theme makes my skin crawl, I still remember being terrified by the dozens of metroids scattered around.
snippet.textOriginal: The claustrophobic environments mixed with the sense of discovering the unknown, the perfect difficulty level, the pure and fun gameplay, the great pixel work and an awesome soundtrack created a classic. Just listening to the Tourian theme makes my skin crawl, I still remember being terrified by the dozens of metroids scattered around.

snippet.textDisplay: This is the closest game to perfection in my book, even more than my Top 3 (which have a bigger nostalgia factor). I played this game back when it released, but it's really years later when I rediscovered it that I realized how much I liked it. I can't really find any glaring flaws. When I said Yoshi's Island is my favorite 2D platformer, that's because I don't really consider Super Metroid a platformer, just like I don't consider Metroid Prime a 3D platformer.
snippet.textOriginal: This is the closest game to perfection in my book, even more than my Top 3 (which have a bigger nostalgia factor). I played this game back when it released, but it's really years later when I rediscovered it that I realized how much I liked it. I can't really find any glaring flaws. When I said Yoshi's Island is my favorite 2D platformer, that's because I don't really consider Super Metroid a platformer, just like I don't consider Metroid Prime a 3D platformer.
